inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getFramework.

tags.description: Tag key-value pair applied to those AWS resources that you want to trigger an evaluation for a rule. A maximum of one key-value pair can be provided.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getFramework.

controls.description: One or more control blocks that make up the framework. Each control in the list has a name, input parameters, and scope. Detailed below.

creationTime.description: Date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

deploymentStatus.description: Deployment status of a framework. The statuses are: `CREATE_IN_PROGRESS` | `UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS` | `DELETE_IN_PROGRESS` | `COMPLETED`| `FAILED`.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: Name of a parameter, for example, BackupPlanFrequency.

status.description: Framework consists of one or more controls. Each control governs a resource, such as backup plans, backup selections, backup vaults, or recovery points. You can also turn AWS Config recording on or off for each resource. The statuses are: `ACTIVE`, `PARTIALLY_ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `UNAVAILABLE`. For more information refer to the [AWS documentation for Framework Status](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-backup/latest/devguide/API_DescribeFramework.html#Backup-DescribeFramework-response-FrameworkStatus)

tags.description: Tag key-value pair applied to those AWS resources that you want to trigger an evaluation for a rule. A maximum of one key-value pair can be provided.
